title: Easily Manage Your Phone’s Contacts on Android

steps.title: Open your Contacts app.
steps.content: Open your Contacts app. If you're using Google Contacts, the app is a blue icon with a white outline of a person in the app drawer. Other devices’ Contacts apps (such as Samsung or Asus) may have different icons and slightly different steps.

steps.title: Tap the contact you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the contact you want to edit. The contact's information will show on a new page.

steps.title: Tap the Edit icon.
steps.content: Tap the Edit icon. You'll either see the word Edit or a pencil icon, and it'll usually be at the upper-right corner or bottom of the screen. [1] X Research source If prompted, choose the Google account you wish to use.

steps.title: Add or change contact information.
steps.content: Add or change contact information. You’ll be able to edit the contact’s phone number, display name, email address, and various other options. Just tap the text field and type in the new information. To add another field (such as address, nickname, or relationship), scroll to the bottom of the contact and tap Add new field . Select the type of field you want to add, then enter the information you want to appear.

steps.title: Tap Save or the checkmark.
steps.content: Tap Save or the checkmark. Your contact will be updated immediately. [2] X Research source
